Class ShipBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.Boards.ShipBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ShipBoard_LevelII, ShipBoard_TestFlight
public abstract class ShipBoard extends Object implements Serializable
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • VioletAlien

      protected boolean VioletAlien
      Indicates the presence of a Violet Alien on the ship board. This field represents whether the ship has a Violet Alien assigned or not. It is used to track and manage state or actions related to the specific type of alien.

    • BrownAlien

      protected boolean BrownAlien
      Represents the presence of a Brown Alien on the spaceship board. This boolean variable indicates whether a Brown Alien is active or exists in the current state of the ShipBoard.

    • state

      protected RemoveTileState state
      Represents the current state of the tile removal process within the shipboard. This variable defines the operational logic and transitions for managing the removal of spaceship tiles based on the specific game state. The state is an instance of the RemoveTileState class, which provides the methods and rules for the ongoing process, including transitioning to the next state, performing main actions during tile removal, and selecting subtile groups as part of the shipboard configuration. This field is protected and intended to be used internally within the ShipBoard class and its subclasses.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShipBoard

      public ShipBoard(FlightBoard flightBoard, Player myPlayer)
      Constructor for the ShipBoard class. Initializes various resources and settings, and associates the shipboard with a flight board and player.
      Parameters:
      flightBoard - the flight board associated with this shipboard
      myPlayer - the player associated with this shipboard

      public RemoveTileState getRemoveTileState()

      Returns:

      true if subship selection is enabled, false otherwise

    • Gonextstate

      public void Gonextstate(ArrayList<ArrayList<SpaceShipTile>> subships, int indextopreserve, int playerID, int waste) throws Exception
      Advances the current game state to the next state and performs the necessary updates.
      Parameters:
      subships - A list of sublists, where each sublist represents a connected block in the spaceship layout.
      indextopreserve - An integer representing the index of a specific subship to preserve during the state transition.
      playerID - An integer representing the unique ID of the player interacting with the spaceship.
      waste - An integer representing the waste generated during the transition to the next state.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any unexpected error occurs during the state transition.

    • getShipMatrix

      public SpaceShipTile[][] getShipMatrix()
      Retrieves the matrix of the spaceship tiles for the current shipboard.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of SpaceShipTile objects representing the structure of the spaceship.

      the Player instance representing the current player.

      true if the object has been modified; false otherwise.

    • setModified

      public void setModified(boolean isModified)
      Sets the modified state of the shipboard.
      Parameters:
      isModified - a boolean value indicating whether the shipboard has been modified (true) or not (false)

    • getAvailableRedGoods

      public int getAvailableRedGoods() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total number of available red goods across all special cargo hold tiles within the shipboard. The method iterates through all tiles of type `Tile_SpecialCargoHold` obtained from the `ShipBoardIterable`. It sums up the size of the effective present goods on each tile to determine the total number of red goods available.
      Returns:
      the total number of red goods available in the special cargo hold tiles
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the calculation process

    • getAvailableBlueGoods

      public int getAvailableBlueGoods() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total number of available blue goods present in all cargo hold tiles of the spaceship. The method iterates through all tiles of type "Tile_CargoHold" in the shipboard and sums the quantity of blue goods found in these tiles.
      Returns:
      the total number of blue goods available in the spaceship.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an issue while calculating the blue goods.

    • isVioletAlien

      public abstract boolean isVioletAlien()
      Checks if this entity is identified as a Violet Alien.
      Returns:
      true if the entity is a Violet Alien, false otherwise.

    • isBrownAlien

      public abstract boolean isBrownAlien()
      Checks whether the shipboard contains a brown alien.
      Returns:
      true if a brown alien is present on the shipboard, false otherwise.

    • getCosmicCredits

      public int getCosmicCredits()

      Returns:
      the current number of cosmic credits

    • addCosmicCredits

      public void addCosmicCredits(int i)
      Adds the specified amount to the current cosmic credits of the ship.
      Parameters:
      i - the amount of cosmic credits to add; can be positive or negative.

    • getAvailableYellowGoods

      public int getAvailableYellowGoods() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total number of yellow goods available on the ShipBoard. The method iterates through all cargo hold tiles on the ship, summing up the quantity of yellow goods in each tile.
      Returns:
      the total count of available yellow goods
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the calculation

    • getAvailableGreenGoods

      public int getAvailableGreenGoods() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total number of green goods available on the shipboard by iterating through all cargo hold tiles and summing up their respective green goods.
      Returns:
      the total number of available green goods on the shipboard
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the calculation process

    • getPassengerNumber

      public int getPassengerNumber() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total number of passengers available in all cabin tiles on the ship. The method iterates through all tiles of type "Tile_Cabin" and sums their effective passenger capacity.
      Returns:
      the total number of passengers available on the ship
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the calculation

    • getShipBoardIterable

      public ShipBoard_iterable getShipBoardIterable() throws RuntimeException
      Provides an iterable representation of the ship's board, allowing iteration over its elements.
      Returns:
      an iterable representing the ship's board
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error returning the ship board iterable

    • updateAttributes

      public void updateAttributes() throws RuntimeException
      Updates the available resources and attributes of the ship board. This method recalculates and refreshes the quantities of goods, passenger count, and battery count by invoking respective getter methods for each attribute. Additionally, it updates the basic firepower and motion power metrics.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if any resource retrieval method fails

    • checkAndCompareGoodsPosition

      public boolean checkAndCompareGoodsPosition(ArrayList<Goods> before, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> after, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> pos)
      Checks and compares the position of goods before and after the operation, ensuring that the goods are valid and correctly assigned to their respective positions in the defined cargo-hold tiles.
      Parameters:
      before - the list of goods owned by the player before the operation, cannot be null
      after - a nested list representing the goods distributed into sets after the operation, where each inner list corresponds to a tile's goods
      pos - a nested list of integer pairs where each pair represents the coordinates of a cargo-hold tile in the spaceship
      Returns:
      true if the goods are correctly positioned and validated according to the rules; false if any condition fails, such as mismatched data, invalid positions, or constraints violations

    • setNonAccessibleTiles

      public abstract void setNonAccessibleTiles() throws RuntimeException
      Defines the tiles on the shipboard that cannot be accessed during the gameplay. This method typically identifies and marks specific areas or zones on the board as non-accessible based on predefined rules or conditions. This is an abstract method and must be implemented by subclasses. The actual implementation will depend on the specific rules or logic associated with the subclass.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the operation encounters an error or if the non-accessible tiles cannot be determined or set due to invalid conditions or data.

    • addLostPieces

      public void addLostPieces(int i)
      Increases the count of lost pieces on the ship board.
      Parameters:
      i - the number of lost pieces to add to the current total

    • addAlien

      public abstract void addAlien(AlienColor alien_colour) throws RuntimeException
      Adds an alien of the specified color to the ship board.
      Parameters:
      alien_colour - the color of the alien to be added, represented by the AlienColor enum
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if adding the alien fails due to an illegal operation or state

    • removeWaitTilesForEndBuilding

      public abstract void removeWaitTilesForEndBuilding()
      Removes the tiles marked as "wait" at the end of the building phase of the shipboard. This method is typically invoked during the finalization process of the ship construction to clean up specific placeholder or temporary tiles used during the building phase. The implementation is abstract to allow subclasses to define the exact behavior depending on the context of the specific shipboard mechanics.

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(SpaceShipTile tile, int x, int y)
      Inserts a SpaceShipTile into the ship matrix at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      tile - The SpaceShipTile to be inserted.
      x - The x-coordinate where the tile should be placed.
      y - The y-coordinate where the tile should be placed.

    • removeAllPassengers

      public void removeAllPassengers() throws Exception
      Removes all passengers from all cabin tiles in the spaceship. This method iterates through all tiles of type SSTTypes.Tile_Cabin on the spaceship board and invokes the removePassenger method on each tile to remove its current number of passengers.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while processing the removal of passengers.

    • looseAllBatteris

      public void looseAllBatteris()
      Removes all battery charges from the battery components on the ship board. This method iterates over all tiles of type `Tile_BatteryComponent` within the ship board. For each tile, if it contains any charges, all the charges are removed, effectively depleting the battery component.

    • looseAllGoods

      public void looseAllGoods()
      Removes all goods from the spaceship by iterating through tiles that can store goods and transferring their contents. This method processes two types of storage tiles: - Special cargo-hold tiles. - Normal cargo-hold tiles. Each tile of the specified types is located using the ShipBoardIterable utility, and the goods on those tiles are moved using the moveGoods method.

    • addBatteryUnit

      public void addBatteryUnit() throws RuntimeException
      Adds a unit of battery by recharging all battery components of the spaceship. This method retrieves all tiles of type SSTTypes.Tile_BatteryComponent from the ship board and invokes the RechargeAll method on each of them, ensuring that their battery capacity is fully restored. If any underlying process fails, a RuntimeException is thrown.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the operation

    • CheckCorrectPeopleToLoose

      public boolean CheckCorrectPeopleToLoose(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> triplets, int tot) throws RuntimeException
      Validates if the total number of people to be removed from the ship matches the provided count, based on the given list of triplets defining removal details. Each triplet contains coordinates and the count of people to be removed from a specific tile in the spaceship.
      Parameters:
      triplets - A list of triplets where each triplet is an ArrayList containing three integers: the x-coordinate, the y-coordinate, and the count of people to be removed from the specified tile.
      tot - The total number of people that need to be removed from the spaceship.
      Returns:
      true if the total number of removals across the specified tiles matches tot, and all removal requests are valid according to the spaceship's occupancy constraints; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if any unexpected error or condition occurs during validation.

    • getMySortedGoods

      public ArrayList<Goods> getMySortedGoods() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves and returns a list of all goods present in the special cargo holds and regular cargo holds of the spaceship, sorted in descending order of their value. The method updates the spaceship's attributes before iterating through these tiles.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Goods objects sorted in descending order of value
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an issue updating attributes or accessing goods

    • SortGoods

      public ArrayList<Goods> SortGoods(ArrayList<Goods> goods) throws RuntimeException
      Sorts a given list of Goods objects in descending order based on their value. The sorting is performed using the predefined comparator BY_VALUE_DESC. If the input list is null, the method does nothing and returns null.
      Parameters:
      goods - an ArrayList of Goods objects to be sorted. It may be null.
      Returns:
      the same ArrayList of Goods, sorted in descending order based on their value, or null if the input list is null.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the sorting process.

    • looseOrAddGoods

      public ArrayList<Goods> looseOrAddGoods(ArrayList<Goods> goodsToAdd, int goodsToLose)
      Modifies the current list of goods by either removing a specified number of goods in order of value or adding a provided list of goods while maintaining descending order by value.
      Parameters:
      goodsToAdd - the list of goods to add; if null or empty, no goods will be added
      goodsToLose - the number of goods to remove; the number of goods actually removed will not exceed the size of the current list of goods
      Returns:
      a new list of goods after applying the additions or removals based on the input parameters

    • calculateExposedConnectors

      public int calculateExposedConnectors() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates the total number of exposed connectors on a spaceship board. An exposed connector is counted if it is adjacent to a tile of type Tile_NonAccesiblePlace or is on the outer edge and not covered by a smooth side. This method iterates through all tiles of the spaceship board and checks each connector to determine if it is exposed based on the tile's position and its neighboring tiles' types.
      Returns:
      the total number of exposed connectors on the spaceship board.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an unexpected condition occurs during the calculation.

    • getLostPieces

      public int getLostPieces()
      Retrieves the current count of lost pieces associated with the ship.
      Returns:
      the number of lost pieces as an integer.

    • removeTile

      public void removeTile(int row, int column, boolean FromMistake) throws Exception
      Removes a tile from the ship at the specified row and column. This method might throw exceptions in case of invalid operations.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index where the tile is located to be removed
      column - the column index where the tile is located to be removed
      FromMistake - specifies if the removal was a result of a mistake
      Throws:
      Exception - if the removal operation fails

    • receiveShot

      public void receiveShot(SpaceShipTile tile) throws Exception
      Processes a received shot on the spaceship by removing the corresponding tile if it is not blocked by a cannon or shield and updating ship attributes accordingly.
      Parameters:
      tile - the SpaceShipTile instance representing the tile which is hit. It must not be null.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an issue occurs while processing the shot, such as retrieving the tile's position or removing the tile.

    • checkCorrectDefence

      public boolean checkCorrectDefence(ArrayList<Integer> values) throws RuntimeException
      Validates if the provided defence configuration is correct based on the game logic.
      Parameters:
      values - an ArrayList of integers representing the coordinates and conditions for the defence validation. The list is expected to contain exactly 4 integers: - values.get(0) and values.get(1): coordinates of the defence tile - values.get(2) and values.get(3): coordinates of the battery component tile Values should be within permissible ranges and represent valid game tiles.
      Returns:
      true if the defence configuration is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if any unexpected error occurs during the validation process.

    • manageShotReceived

      public void manageShotReceived(Shot shot, ArrayList<Integer> values, int dice) throws Exception
      Manages the process of handling a shot received by the ship. Based on the type of shot, it delegates to the appropriate handling method.
      Parameters:
      shot - the shot object containing information about the type of shot to be handled
      values - an ArrayList of integers representing values necessary for the calculation or logic involved in handling the shot
      dice - an integer representing the dice roll outcome that influences the behavior of the shot handling
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the handling process of the shot

    • getTotalResourcesScore

      public int getTotalResourcesScore() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total resource score for the ship. The score is computed based on the weighted sum of the available goods: - Red goods contribute 4 points each. - Blue goods contribute 1 point each. - Yellow goods contribute 3 points each. - Green goods contribute 2 points each. The method updates the attributes of the ship before computation.
      Returns:
      the total resource score as an integer.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if resource attributes cannot be updated.

    • removePassengers

      public void removePassengers(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> tiles, int numPass) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • checkPairofConnectors

      public boolean checkPairofConnectors(Type_side_connector c1, Type_side_connector c2) throws RuntimeException
      Checks if a pair of connectors can fit or align with each other based on their type. A connector of type SMOOTH_SIDE is not compatible with any other connector and always returns false. A connector of type UNIV_connector can match any type of connector. Otherwise, the method checks if the two connectors are of the same type.
      Parameters:
      c1 - the first connector of type Type_side_connector
      c2 - the second connector of type Type_side_connector
      Returns:
      true if the connectors can match based on their type; false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an unexpected error occurs during the connector comparison

    • checkConnectorsPosition

      public boolean checkConnectorsPosition(Type_side_connector c1, Type_side_connector c2)
      Checks if two connectors are positioned in a valid configuration relative to each other. Ensures the connectors adhere to rules regarding smooth sides, universal connectors, and incompatible matches.
      Parameters:
      c1 - the first connector of type Type_side_connector
      c2 - the second connector of type Type_side_connector
      Returns:
      true if the connectors are validly positioned, false otherwise

    • getBatteriesNumber

      public int getBatteriesNumber() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates and returns the total number of available battery units on the ship. The method iterates over all tiles of type "BatteryComponent" in the ship's board and sums up their effective capacities.
      Returns:
      the total number of available battery units
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs while retrieving battery information

    • removeBlock

      public int removeBlock(ArrayList<SpaceShipTile> block) throws RuntimeException
      Removes a block of SpaceShipTile objects from the flight board and updates the associated bank. The method retrieves the position of each tile, processes it according to its type, and replaces it with a placeholder tile. Additionally, it updates the lost pieces count.
      Parameters:
      block - the list of SpaceShipTile objects to be removed from the flight board
      Returns:
      the total number of tiles removed
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the tile position retrieval fails or a null position is encountered

    • checkCorrectCannonBatteries

      public boolean checkCorrectCannonBatteries(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, Player player) throws Exception
      Validates the positions of cannon tiles and battery tiles on a player's spaceship, ensuring that all specified positions correspond to the correct tile types and that there are enough battery components to power the cannons.
      Parameters:
      cannonPos - a list of positions representing the cannon tiles; each position is an ArrayList where the first element is the row index and the second element is the column index.
      batteriesPos - a list of positions representing the battery tiles; each position is an ArrayList where the first element is the row index, the second element is the column index, and the third value is the number of charges to allocate from the tile.
      player - the player whose spaceship matrix will be validated.
      Returns:
      true if all cannon and battery positions are valid, the correct types, and with batteries providing sufficient power for all cannons; otherwise, false.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an issue accessing the spaceship matrix or other data during validation.

    • checkCorrectEngineBatteries

      public boolean checkCorrectEngineBatteries(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> motorPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, Player player) throws RuntimeException
      Validates whether the given engine positions and battery positions are correctly configured such that the number of engines is equal to the total number of available battery charges. The method ensures that all provided engine and battery positions correspond to valid components on the player's spaceship and checks that batteries have sufficient charges for use.
      Parameters:
      motorPos - a list of positions specifying the locations of engines. Each position is an ArrayList containing row and column indices (in that order) of the engine tile.
      batteriesPos - a list of positions specifying the locations and assigned charges of batteries. Each position is an ArrayList containing row, column indices, and the number of charges being utilized from that battery (in that order).
      player - the Player object whose spaceship configuration is being validated.
      Returns:
      true if the number of engines matches the total battery charges provided, and both the engines and batteries are valid components; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the spaceship tiles or configuration data cause unexpected errors during validation.

    • getTotalFirePower

      public abstract float getTotalFirePower(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, Player player)
      Calculates the total firepower of the ship based on its cannon and battery positions, as well as the current state of the player.
      Parameters:
      cannonPos - a list of lists representing the positions of the cannons on the ship
      batteriesPos - a list of lists representing the positions of the batteries on the ship
      player - the player whose ship's firepower is being calculated
      Returns:
      the total firepower value as a floating-point number

    • getTotalMotionPower

      public abstract int getTotalMotionPower(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> enginePos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, Player player)
      Calculates the total motion power of the ship using the specified positions of engines and batteries in conjunction with the player's attributes.
      Parameters:
      enginePos - a list of lists representing the positions of the engines on the shipboard
      batteriesPos - a list of lists representing the positions of the batteries on the shipboard
      player - the Player object associated with the ship, whose attributes might impact the motion power
      Returns:
      the calculated total motion power of the ship

    • getBasicMotionPower

      public int getBasicMotionPower() throws RuntimeException
      Throws:
      RuntimeException

    • getBasicFirePower

      public float getBasicFirePower() throws RuntimeException
      Calculates the basic firepower of the spaceship based on the cannon tiles present on the shipboard. Each cannon tile contributes to the total firepower depending on its orientation: - If the cannon tile's rotation is 0, it provides 1 firepower. - For other rotations, it provides 0.5 firepower.
      Returns:
      the total basic firepower of the spaceship as a floating-point number.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error accessing or processing the cannon tiles.

    • checkGoodsInput

      public boolean checkGoodsInput(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storagetiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newgoods, ArrayList<Goods> cardgoods) throws Exception
      Checks if the goods input into the storage tiles is valid and feasible based on the constraints and the current state of the spaceship tiles and card goods.
      Parameters:
      storagetiles - the list of coordinates (row and column) for the storage tiles where goods are to be placed
      newgoods - the corresponding list of goods to be placed in the storage tiles
      cardgoods - the list of goods obtained from cards
      Returns:
      true if the goods input is valid and meets the constraints, false otherwise
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the process

    • checkCorrectBatteriesDistribution

      public boolean checkCorrectBatteriesDistribution(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> BattxPos, int quantTot)
      Validates if the distribution of batteries across specific ship tiles is correct by checking whether the total quantity matches the expected total and that proper conditions are met for each tile.
      Parameters:
      BattxPos - A list of entries where each entry represents a battery distribution. Each entry must contain exactly three integers: the x-coordinate, the y-coordinate, and the quantity of batteries allocated.
      quantTot - The expected total quantity of batteries that should be allocated across all entries.
      Returns:
      true if the distribution is valid and meets all checks; false otherwise.

    • assertBatteryPos

      public void assertBatteryPos(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> BattxPos)
      Updates the charge level of tiles in a spaceship matrix based on the specified battery positions and charges.
      Parameters:
      BattxPos - A 2D list where each inner list contains three integers: the x-coordinate, y-coordinate, and charge value of a battery to be set.

    • addGoods

      public void addGoods(ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storagetiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newgoods)
      Updates the storage tiles of the spaceship with new goods, while also synchronizing the changes with the bank inventory. Modifies the list of goods present in the specified storage tiles and adjusts the bank inventory based on the difference between the goods present before and after the modification.
      Parameters:
      storagetiles - A two-dimensional list representing the positions (row, column) of the spaceship's storage tiles to be updated. Each inner list should contain exactly two integers, where the first value represents the row and the second the column.
      newgoods - A two-dimensional list containing the new goods to be placed in the specified storage tiles. Each inner list contains the goods that will replace the current goods in the corresponding storage tile.

    • findConnectedBlocks

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<SpaceShipTile>> findConnectedBlocks() throws RuntimeException
      Finds and returns a list of connected blocks of SpaceShipTile objects in the ship matrix. A connected block is a group of adjacent tiles that are accessible and belong to the same logical block. The method skips non-accessible tiles or null entries in the matrix.
      Returns:
      A list of connected blocks, where each block is represented as an ArrayList of SpaceShipTile objects.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the operation.

    • exploreBlock

      public void exploreBlock(int r, int c, boolean[][] visited, ArrayList<SpaceShipTile> block) throws RuntimeException
      Explores and identifies all interconnected tiles starting from a given tile (r, c) in a matrix, using a recursive flood-fill approach. Adds all valid connected tiles to the provided block list.
      Parameters:
      r - The row index of the starting tile.
      c - The column index of the starting tile.
      visited - A 2D boolean array marking visited tiles to prevent revisiting.
      block - A list to collect all interconnected valid tiles.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an unexpected runtime issue occurs during execution.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected(SpaceShipTile tile, int newRow, int newCol) throws RuntimeException
      Determines if a given tile is connected to another tile at a specified position on the shipboard grid based on tile properties and grid constraints.
      Parameters:
      tile - the current SpaceShipTile to be checked for connection.
      newRow - the row index of the target position to check.
      newCol - the column index of the target position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the tile is connected to the tile at the specified position; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if any unexpected error occurs during the connection check.

    • checkAllConnectorsofTiles

      public boolean checkAllConnectorsofTiles(SpaceShipTile tile1, SpaceShipTile tile2) throws RuntimeException
      Checks if all connectors between two given tiles of the spaceship are properly aligned and compatible based on their relative positioning on the shipboard.
      Parameters:
      tile1 - the first tile to compare.
      tile2 - the second tile to compare.
      Returns:
      true if all corresponding connectors of the two tiles are compatible or the tiles are non-accessible, otherwise returns false.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an issue obtaining the tile position or checking connectors.

    • isCompletelyFilled

      public boolean isCompletelyFilled() throws RuntimeException
      Checks if the spaceship is completely filled, based on the presence of aliens and passengers in adjacent tiles of specified types. This method iterates through all tiles of type `SSTTypes.Tile_AlienLifeSupport` and verifies if adjacent tiles of type `SSTTypes.Tile_Cabin` meet certain conditions, such as the absence of aliens and passengers being equal to zero.
      Returns:
      true if the spaceship is completely filled based on the described conditions; false otherwise
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the processing of tiles

    • setMyPlayer

      public void setMyPlayer(Player p1)
      Sets the player associated with this ShipBoard instance.
      Parameters:
      p1 - the Player object to be assigned to this ShipBoard

    • addLonelyPassengers

      public void addLonelyPassengers() throws Exception
      Adds passengers to spaceship cabin tiles under specific conditions. This method identifies lonely cabins on the spaceship and populates them with passengers. A cabin is considered "lonely" if it is empty, has no adjacent support tiles with unique alien colors, or if certain predefined conditions about its position are met. The method performs the following operations: 1. Collects a set of alien colors already aboard the spaceship from aliens found in cabin tiles. 2. Iterates over all cabin tiles and skips those already occupied by passengers or aliens. 3. Identifies adjacent support tiles to the current cabin and gathers their alien colors that are not already aboard. 4. Determines whether a cabin is lonely based on the absence of adjacent supports or the lack of free alien colors. 5. Adds two passengers to any cabin identified as lonely or meeting specific position conditions.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an unexpected error occurs during execution.

    • addSupportIfAny

      public void addSupportIfAny(List<SpaceShipTile> list, int r, int c)
      Adds a SpaceShipTile to the provided list if a tile exists at the specified row and column in the matrix and the tile type is Alien Life Support.
      Parameters:
      list - the list to which the Alien Life Support tile will be added if present
      r - the row index to check in the ShipMatrix
      c - the column index to check in the ShipMatrix

    • calculateNumOfHumans

      public int calculateNumOfHumans()
      Calculates the total number of human passengers across all cabin tiles in the spaceship. Iterates through the spaceship's tile matrix, identifying tiles of type Tile_Cabin, and sums up the number of human passengers in these tiles.
      Returns:
      the total number of human passengers in the spaceship.

    • getTotalPassengers

      public int getTotalPassengers()
      Calculates and returns the total number of passengers, including any aliens present, on all cabin tiles of the spaceship. Iterates through each cabin tile, adds the number of passengers on the tile, and includes an additional count if an alien is present on the tile.
      Returns:
      the total number of passengers and aliens across all cabin tiles

    • getAllPassengerTiles

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> getAllPassengerTiles()
      Retrieves all passenger tiles on the spaceship along with their coordinates and the total count of passengers or aliens present on each tile. This method scans the spaceship to identify tiles of type 'Cabin' that have at least one passenger or alien and gathers the required information.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of ArrayLists where each inner ArrayList contains: - The row coordinate of the tile (index 0) - The column coordinate of the tile (index 1) - The total number of passengers and aliens on the tile (index 2)

    • checkSurrender

      public void checkSurrender() throws Exception
      Evaluates whether the current player should surrender based on the state of their ship. The method determines if the player has met the necessary conditions to continue the game. It checks the following: - If the player's ship contains any tiles of type `Tile_Cabin`. - If the player's ship has a sufficient number of humans. If the ship has no `Tile_Cabin` tiles or the number of humans is zero or less, the method will invoke the surrender action for the current player.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an unexpected error occurs during the surrender check process.
